defguard-gateway.description: Defguard Gateway is a public-facing VPN endpoint.

enabled.description: Conditional property used in parent chart
enabled.title: enabled

existingTokenSecret.description: Secret to get the token from
existingTokenSecret.title: existingTokenSecret

existingTokenSecretKey.description: Key to extract the token from in existingTokenSecret
existingTokenSecretKey.title: existingTokenSecretKey

global.description: Global values are values that can be accessed from any chart or subchart by exactly the same name.
global.title: global

logLevel.description: rust log level, default is debug
logLevel.title: logLevel

securityContext.description:
defguard-gateway container security context
elevated priveleges are required for managing network interfaces
securityContext.title: securityContext

statsPeriod.description: Defines how often (in seconds) should interface statistics be sent to Defguard server
statsPeriod.title: statsPeriod

token.description:
Token from Defguard app to secure gRPC connection, available on network page.
It is not recommended to use this. Create a secret yourself and use existingTokenSecret instead
token.title: token

userspace.description: Use userspace wireguard implementation, useful on systems without native wireguard support. Set to true/false
userspace.title: userspace

defguard-gateway.title: defguard-gateway

defguard-proxy.description: Defguard proxy is a public-facing proxy for core Defguard service

enabled.description: defguard-proxy is turned off by default. enable to allow use of the enrollment interface
enabled.title: enabled

global.description: Global values are values that can be accessed from any chart or subchart by exactly the same name.
global.title: global

postgresql.description: PostgreSQL (Postgres) is an open source object-relational database known for reliability and data integrity. ACID-compliant, it supports foreign keys, joins, views, triggers and stored procedures.

backup.description:
#
# This section implements a trivial logical dump cronjob of the database.
# This only comes with the consistency guarantees of the dump program.
# This is not a snapshot based roll forward/backward recovery backup.
# ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/cron-jobs/

networkPolicy.description:
# resources:
#   requests:
#     cpu: 1
#     memory: 512Mi
#   limits:
#     cpu: 2
#     memory: 1024Mi

# If undefined (the default) or set to null, no storageClassName spec is
# set, choosing the default provisioner.

storageClass.title: storageClass

subPath.description:
#
# and one PV for multiple services.

debug.description:

pullSecrets.description:
# Optionally specify an array of imagePullSecrets.
# Secrets must be manually created in the namespace.

# pullSecrets:

pullSecrets.title: pullSecrets

ldap.description:
# LDAP configuration
#
#
#
#
#
# DEPRECATED ldap.baseDN It will removed in a future, please use 'ldap.basedn' instead
# DEPRECATED ldap.bindDN It will removed in a future, please use 'ldap.binddn' instead
# DEPRECATED ldap.bind_password It will removed in a future, please use 'ldap.bindpw' instead
#
#
#
# DEPRECATED ldap.search_attr It will removed in a future, please use 'ldap.searchAttribute' instead
# DEPRECATED ldap.search_filter It will removed in a future, please use 'ldap.searchFilter' instead
#
#
#
# DEPRECATED ldap.tls as string is deprecated, please use 'ldap.tls.enabled' instead
#
#
ldap.title: ldap

containerSecurityContext.description:
# PostgreSQL Prometheus exporter containers' Security Context
# ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/security-context/#set-the-security-context-for-a-container
#
#
#
#
#
#
#
#
#
#
#
containerSecurityContext.title: containerSecurityContext

customMetrics.description:
#
# ref: https://github.com/prometheus-community/postgres_exporter#adding-new-metrics-via-a-config-file-deprecated
# customMetrics:
#   pg_database:
#     query: "SELECT d.datname AS name, CASE WHEN pg_catalog.has_database_privilege(d.datname, 'CONNECT') THEN pg_catalog.pg_database_size(d.datname) ELSE 0 END AS size_bytes FROM pg_catalog.pg_database d where datname not in ('template0', 'template1', 'postgres')"
#     metrics:
#       - name:
#           usage: "LABEL"
#           description: "Name of the database"
#       - size_bytes:
#           usage: "GAUGE"
#           description: "Size of the database in bytes"
#
customMetrics.title: customMetrics

extraEnvVars.description:
#
# see: https://github.com/prometheus-community/postgres_exporter#environment-variables
# For example:
#  extraEnvVars:
#  - name: PG_EXPORTER_DISABLE_DEFAULT_METRICS
#    value: "true"
#
extraEnvVars.title: extraEnvVars

pullSecrets.description:
# Optionally specify an array of imagePullSecrets.
# Secrets must be manually created in the namespace.
# ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/pull-image-private-registry/
# Example:
# pullSecrets:
#   - myRegistryKeySecretName
#
pullSecrets.title: pullSecrets

livenessProbe.description:
# Configure extra options for PostgreSQL Prometheus exporter containers' liveness, readiness and startup probes
# ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/configure-liveness-readiness-startup-probes/#configure-probes
#
#
#
#
#
#
#
livenessProbe.title: livenessProbe

prometheusRule.description:
# Custom PrometheusRule to be defined
# The value is evaluated as a template, so, for example, the value can depend on .Release or .Chart
# ref: https://github.com/coreos/prometheus-operator#customresourcedefinitions
#

rules.description:
#
# Make sure to constraint the rules to the current postgresql service.
# rules:
#   - alert: HugeReplicationLag
#     expr: pg_replication_lag{service="{{ printf "%s-metrics" (include "postgresql.v1.chart.fullname" .) }}"} / 3600 > 1
#     for: 1m
#     labels:
#       severity: critical
#     annotations:
#       description: replication for {{ include "postgresql.v1.chart.fullname" . }} PostgreSQL is lagging by {{ "{{ $value }}" }} hour(s).
#       summary: PostgreSQL replication is lagging by {{ "{{ $value }}" }} hour(s).
#
rules.title: rules

prometheusRule.title: prometheusRule

resources.description:
#
# Example:
# resources:
#   requests:
#     cpu: 2
#     memory: 512Mi
#   limits:
#     cpu: 3
#     memory: 1024Mi
#
resources.title: resources

initContainers.title: initContainers

scripts.description:

#      #!/bin/sh
#      echo "Do something."
#
scripts.title: scripts

#

livenessProbe.description:

# ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/configure-liveness-readiness-startup-probes/#configure-probes
#
#
#
#
#
#
#
livenessProbe.title: livenessProbe

allowExternal.description:
#
# The Policy model to apply. When set to false, only pods with the correct
# server label will have network access to the ports server is listening
# on. When true, server will accept connections from any source
# (with the correct destination port).
#
allowExternal.title: allowExternal

extraEgress.description:
#
# e.g:
# extraEgress:
#   - ports:
#       - port: 1234
#     to:
#       - podSelector:
#           - matchLabels:
#               - role: frontend
#       - podSelector:
#           - matchExpressions:
#               - key: role
#                 operator: In
#                 values:
#                   - frontend
#
extraEgress.title: extraEgress

extraIngress.description:
#
# e.g:
# extraIngress:
#   - ports:
#       - port: 1234
#     from:
#       - podSelector:
#           - matchLabels:
#               - role: frontend
#       - podSelector:
#           - matchExpressions:
#               - key: role
#                 operator: In
#                 values:
#                   - frontend
extraIngress.title: extraIngress

standby.description:

# By default docker and containerd (and possibly other container runtimes) limit `/dev/shm` to `64M`
# ref: https://github.com/docker-library/postgres/issues/416
